Post.content:
0. Array.length

1.

  • unshift(element1, ..., elementN):**()**
  • shift():**()**

  • push(element1, ..., elementN):**()**

  • pop(): **()**

  • splice(start[, deleteCount[, item1[, item2[, ...]]]]):**()**

// 2  0 drum  "guitar"
var myFish = ['angel', 'clown', 'mandarin', 'sturgeon'];
var removed = myFish.splice(2, 0, 'drum', 'guitar');

//  myFish: ["angel", "clown", "drum", "guitar", "mandarin", "sturgeon"]
// : [],
  • slice([begin[, end]]):() beginend()
//
var fruits = ['Banana', 'Orange', 'Lemon', 'Apple', 'Mango'];
var citrus = fruits.slice(1, 3);

// fruits contains ['Banana', 'Orange', 'Lemon', 'Apple', 'Mango']
// citrus contains ['Orange','Lemon']
  • concat(value1[, value2[, ...[, valueN]]]):()
var num1 = [1, 2, 3],
    num2 = [4, 5, 6],
    num3 = [7, 8, 9];

var nums = num1.concat(num2, num3);

console.log(nums);
// results in [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9]

  • indexOf(searchElement[, fromIndex]):-1
  • includes(valueToFind[, fromIndex]):,
  • findIndex(callback[, thisArg]):-1
  • find(callback[, thisArg]): undefined(callback3)
//
var inventory = [
    {name: 'apples', quantity: 2},
    {name: 'bananas', quantity: 0},
    {name: 'cherries', quantity: 5}
];

function findCherries(fruit) {
    return fruit.name === 'cherries';
}

console.log(inventory.find(findCherries)); // { name: 'cherries', quantity: 5 }

2.

  • reverse():**()**

  • sort([compareFunction]):**()**

    function compare(value1, value2) {
  if (value1 < value2) {
      //0,value1,value2
      return -1;
  } else if (value1 > value2) {
      //0,value2,value1
      return 1;
  } else {
      //,
      return 0;
  }
}
let values = [0, 1, 5, 10, 15];
values.sort(compare);
alert(values); // 0,1,5,10,15

3.

  • join([separator]):
    ```js
    const elements = [Fire, Air, Water];

console.log(elements.join());
// expected output: Fire,Air,Water

console.log(elements.join());
// expected output: FireAirWater

console.log(elements.join(-));
// expected output: Fire-Air-Water



### 4. (forEachreduce)
- `some(callback(element[, index[, array]])[, thisArg])`:1
```js
// 10
function isBiggerThan10(element, index, array) {
  return element > 10;
}

[2, 5, 8, 1, 4].some(isBiggerThan10);  // false
[12, 5, 8, 1, 4].some(isBiggerThan10); // true
  • every(callback(element[, index[, array]])[, thisArg]):
// 10
function isBigEnough(element, index, array) {
  return element >= 10;
}
[12, 5, 8, 130, 44].every(isBigEnough);   // false
[12, 54, 18, 130, 44].every(isBigEnough); // true
  • forEach(callback(currentValue [, index [, array]])[, thisArg]):callbackforEachundefined**()**
    ```js
    // for forEach
    const items = [item1, item2, item3];
    const copy = [];

// before
for (let i=0; i<items.length; i++) {
copy.push(items[i]);
}

// after
items.forEach(function(item){
copy.push(item);
});


```js
let arr = [12, 4, 6, 89, 2]
//index
arr.forEach((item,index) => {
    console.log(index+ ':' +item)
})
// 0:12
// 1:4
// 2:6
// 3:89
// 4:2

  • filter(callback(element[, index[, array]])[, thisArg]):, 

    function isBigEnough(element) {
return element >= 10;
}
var filtered = [12, 5, 8, 130, 44].filter(isBigEnough);
// filtered is [12, 130, 44]

  • map(callback(currentValue[, index[, array]]){ return element }[, thisArg])):

var numbers = [1, 4, 9];
var doubles = numbers.map(function(num) {
  return num * 2;
});

// doubles [2, 8, 18]
// numbers [1, 4, 9]
  • reduce((previousValue, currentValue, currentIndex, array) => { /* ... */ }, initialValue): reducer reducer 
[15, 16, 17, 18, 19].reduce( (previousValue, currentValue, currentIndex, array) => previousValue + currentValue, 10 )
//95

// .reduce() () .filter().map() ()
const numbers = [-5, 6, 2, 0];

const doubledPositiveNumbers = numbers.reduce((previousValue, currentValue) => {
  if (currentValue > 0) {
    const doubled = currentValue * 2;
    previousValue.push(doubled);
  }
  return previousValue;
}, []);

console.log(doubledPositiveNumbers); // [12, 4]

//
let names = ['Alice', 'Bob', 'Tiff', 'Bruce', 'Alice']

let countedNames = names.reduce(function (allNames, name) {
  if (name in allNames) {
    allNames[name]++
  }
  else {
    allNames[name] = 1
  }
  return allNames
}, {})
// countedNames is:
// { 'Alice': 2, 'Bob': 1, 'Tiff': 1, 'Bruce': 1 }

// 
let myArray = ['a', 'b', 'a', 'b', 'c', 'e', 'e', 'c', 'd', 'd', 'd', 'd']
let myArrayWithNoDuplicates = myArray.reduce(function (previousValue, currentValue) {
  if (previousValue.indexOf(currentValue) === -1) {
    previousValue.push(currentValue)
  }
  return previousValue
}, [])

console.log(myArrayWithNoDuplicates)

5. 

function add(x, y) {
  return x + y;
}
const numbers = [1, 2];
add(...numbers) // 3

const arr1 = [1, 2];
const arr2 = [...arr1];


const arr1 = ['two', 'three'];
const arr2 = ['one', ...arr1, 'four', 'five'];
// ["one", "two", "three", "four", "five"]

const [first, ...rest] = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5];
first // 1
rest  // [2, 3, 4, 5]


const [...rest, last] = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5];         // 
const [first, ...rest, last] = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5];  // 

[...'hello']    // [ "h", "e", "l", "l", "o" ]
  • Iterator 

// argumentsarguments[0]arguments[1]arguments[2]
function foo() {
  const args = [...arguments];
}

es5Array.prototype.slice.call(arguments)

  • Math
const numbers = [9, 4, 7, 1];
Math.min(...numbers); // 1
Math.max(...numbers); // 9

6.

  • Array.from(arrayLike[, mapFn[, thisArg]]):
    let arrayLike = {
  '0': 'a',
  '1': 'b',
  '2': 'c',
  length: 3
};
let arr2 = Array.from(arrayLike); // ['a', 'b', 'c']
  • Array.of(element0[, element1[, ...[, elementN]]]):
    ```js
    Array.of(7); // [7]
    Array.of(1, 2, 3); // [1, 2, 3]

Array(7); // [ , , , , , , ]
Array(1, 2, 3); // [1, 2, 3]



### 7. 
- `Object.prototype.toString.call()`

```javascript
Object.prototype.toString.call(obj).slice(8,-1) === 'Array';

obj.__proto__ === Array.prototype;
  • ES6Array.isArray()
Array.isArray(obj);
  • instanceof
obj instanceof Array

  • constructor

    (obj).constructor === Array

  • Array.prototype.isPrototypeOf

Array.prototype.isPrototypeOf(obj)

8.

+indexOf()

let arr = [1,'1',2,'2',1,2,'x','y','f','x','y','f'];

function unique1(arr){
    let result = [arr[0]];
    for (let i = 1; i < arr.length; i++) {
        let item = arr[i];
        //arr
        if(result.indexOf(item) == -1){
            result.push(item);
        }
    }
    return result;
}

console.log(unique1(arr));

let myArray = ['a', 'b', 'a', 'b', 'c', 'e', 'e', 'c', 'd', 'd', 'd', 'd']
let myArrayWithNoDuplicates = myArray.reduce(function (previousValue, currentValue) {
  if (previousValue.indexOf(currentValue) === -1) {
    previousValue.push(currentValue)
  }
  return previousValue
}, [])

console.log(myArrayWithNoDuplicates)

Hash

let arr = [1,'1',2,'2',1,2,'x','y','f','x','y','f'];

function unique2(arr){
    let result = [];
    let obj ={};

    for(let i =0;i<arr.length;i++){
      let item = arr[i];
      if(!obj[item]){
        result.push(item);
        obj[item] = 1;
      }
    }

    return result;
}
console.log(unique2(arr))

12String12Number12Hash

sort()

let arr = [1,'1',2,'2',1,2,'x','y','f','x','y','f'];

function unique3(arr) {
    let result = [arr[0]];
    arr = arr.sort();
    for (let i = 1; i < arr.length; i++) {
        let item = arr[i];
        //
        if (item !== result[result.length - 1]) {
            result.push(item)
        }
    }
    return result;
}

console.log(unique3(arr))

Set

let arr = [1,'1',2,'2',1,2,'x','y','f','x','y','f'];

function unique4(arr){
    return Array.from(new Set(arr));
}

console.log(unique4(arr));

var inventory = [
    {name: 'apples', quantity: 2},
    {name: 'bananas', quantity: 0},
    {name: 'cherries', quantity: 5}
];

function findCherries(fruit) {

}

console.log(inventory.find(findCherries)); // { name: 'cherries', quantity: 5 }

    function compare(value1, value2) {
  if (value1 < value2) {
      //0,value1,value2
      return -1;
  } else if (value1 > value2) {
      //0,value2,value1
      return 1;
  } else {
      //,
      return 0;
  }
}
let values = [0, 1, 5, 10, 15];
values.sort(compare);
alert(values); // 0,1,5,10,15

    ```js

console.log(elements.join());
// expected output: Fire,Air,Water

console.log(elements.join());
// expected output: FireAirWater

console.log(elements.join(-));
// expected output: Fire-Air-Water



### 4. (forEachreduce)

copy.push(items[i]);
}

// after
items.forEach(function(item){
copy.push(item);
});

<style>
    .father{
        width:500px;
        height:300px;
        border:1px solid #0a3b98;
        position: relative;
    }
    .son{
        width:100px;
        height:40px;
        background: #f0a238;
        position: absolute;
        top:0;
        left:0;
        right:0;
        bottom:0;
        margin:auto;
    }
</style>
<div class="father">
    <div class="son"></div>
</div>

2+margin:50%

top:50% left:50% margin 

<style>
    .father {
        position: relative;
        width: 200px;
        height: 200px;
        background: skyblue;
    }
    .son {
        width: 100px;
        height: 100px;
        background: red;
        position: absolute;
        top: 50%;
        left: 50%;
        margin-left:-50px;   /*  width  */
        margin-top:-50px;  /*  height  */
    }
</style>
<div class="father">
    <div class="son"></div>
</div>

top:50% left:50% transform: translate(-50%,-50%) ,

---

## 
### 0. :String.length
### 1. 

- `+, +=`
- `substring(indexStart[, indexEnd])`:(indexStart,indexEnd], 
- `toLowerCase() toUpperCase()`:/
- `chatAt(index)`:
- `indexOf(searchValue [, fromIndex])`: String  fromIndex  -1
```js
"Blue Whale".indexOf("Blue")       //  0
"Blue Whale".indexOf("Blute")      //  -1
"Blue Whale".indexOf("Whale", 0)   //  5
"Blue Whale".indexOf("Whale", 5)   //  5
"Blue Whale".indexOf("", -1)       //  0
"Blue Whale".indexOf("", 9)        //  9
"Blue Whale".indexOf("", 10)       //  10
"Blue Whale".indexOf("", 11)       //  10
```
- `includes(searchString[, position])`: true  false

### 2. 
- `split([separator[, limit]])`:String

```js
// 0  3 splits
var myString = "Hello World. How are you doing?";
var splits = myString.split(" ", 3);

console.log(splits);
//["Hello", "World.", "How"]
```

### 3. 
- `replace(regexp|substr, newSubStr|function)`:replacementpattern
```js
let text = "cat, bat, sat, fat";
let result = text.replace("at", "ond");
console.log(result); // "cond, bat, sat, fat"
```
```js
//(g)(i),replace'oranges'"apples".
var re = /apples/gi;
var str = "Apples are round, and apples are juicy.";
var newstr = str.replace(re, "oranges");

// oranges are round, and oranges are juicy.
console.log(newstr);
```

## 
### 0. :String.length
### 1. 

- `+, +=`
- `substring(indexStart[, indexEnd])`:(indexStart,indexEnd], 
- `toLowerCase() toUpperCase()`:/
- `chatAt(index)`:
- `indexOf(searchValue [, fromIndex])`: String  fromIndex  -1
```js
"Blue Whale".indexOf("Blue")       //  0
"Blue Whale".indexOf("Blute")      //  -1
"Blue Whale".indexOf("Whale", 0)   //  5
"Blue Whale".indexOf("Whale", 5)   //  5
"Blue Whale".indexOf("", -1)       //  0
"Blue Whale".indexOf("", 9)        //  9
"Blue Whale".indexOf("", 10)       //  10
"Blue Whale".indexOf("", 11)       //  10
```
- `includes(searchString[, position])`: true  false

### 2. 
- `split([separator[, limit]])`:String

```js
// 0  3 splits
var myString = "Hello World. How are you doing?";
var splits = myString.split(" ", 3);

console.log(splits);
//["Hello", "World.", "How"]
```

### 3. 
- `replace(regexp|substr, newSubStr|function)`:replacementpattern
```js
let text = "cat, bat, sat, fat";
let result = text.replace("at", "ond");
console.log(result); // "cond, bat, sat, fat"
```
```js
//(g)(i),replace'oranges'"apples".
var re = /apples/gi;
var str = "Apples are round, and apples are juicy.";
var newstr = str.replace(re, "oranges");

// oranges are round, and oranges are juicy.
console.log(newstr);
```
